content.description: Start on the small bouldery outcrop.  The first bolt is above the outcrop.  First pitch (10c) is appx 100 feet to a two bolt anchor. Head to the left of a small overhang (crux), then to the right of a larger overhang.  Second pitch (10b) is bolted straight up to top (appx 100 feet).  See Jemez Rock and Pecos Area guide by Marc Beverly for picture of route.
content.protection: Bolted.  Anchors at top of 1st and 2nd pitch.
content.location: Middle of Spectator Wall.   A full 60 meter rope needed to get down both pitches.  A 70 meter rope would be better.

content.description: P1 - 15 feet left of main dihedral.  Large overhang on the right side of headwall. Follow bolts to chains to the left of the large overhang (100 ft).     P2 - (crux) Hand traverse right above roof and unto easier slab/ramp system.  This pitch is said to have a committing and exposed pull.     P3 - Straight up, then an overhang to anchors.
content.protection: Quickdraws.  Optional gear placement on P2.
content.location: 15 feet right of Moist Hoist, 15 feet left of the main dihedral.

climbs.name: Outlander
climbs.fa: Tom Wezwick, Matt Gray, Mark Thomas

content.description: (P1) 5.11 Climb up a black streaked face and then right of a large overhang. Crux just before the chains.   (P2) 5.11b/c Climb straight up to the left of a left facing dihedral.   A few crux moves at the top display a hidden anchor with chains.
content.protection: Anchors at the top of P1 and P2.  14-15 quickdraws needed for both pitches.
content.location: Leftmost climb on Spectator Wall (appx 40 feet left of Vicarious Living). Start on left side of large ramp.    Rap down.  70 meter rope recommended for a safe decent but not a necessity.

content.description: P1 - Climb up to two bolt anchor at the center of a diagonal crach and over two large black bulges(100 ft - 5.10).    P2 - Follow bolts up. Some loose rock toward the top.  Alternate and easier finish goes up the last 20 feet.  Could use small stoppers at beginning of P2. (100ft - 5.10)

The large west facing wall on the river side of the road, clearly visible before you go through the first tunnel.  

Rock quality varies dramatically depending on where you are on the wall. Pretty secluded as the approach is long by Gilman standards. Multi-pitch sport climbing with some trad. Routes are 2 or 3 pitches long. Definitely not full developed yet. There is room for more routes so have at it.
